Inside view and outside view

By Amin Zamani in books

As a solution to “planning fallacy”, Daniel Kahneman introduces “outside view” in his book Thinking: fast and slow. I first heard about it in a podcast by Azarakhsh Mokri, an Iranian psychiatrist.

August 19, 2025

Question

By Amin Zamani in thoughts

Imagine you’re an expert in field A. Is it better to apply the tools you know from your field in another field, say B, or to find out for tools from other fields, say B’s, and apply them to the problems in your field?

August 19, 2025

Manifestations of resonance!

By Amin Zamani in physics, fun

In ping pong, sometimes a “resonance” happens. A condition where the amplitude of oscillations keeps growing where the amplitude refers to the distance that the players have with the table. Its like a amusement park swing where if you drive it on the natural resonance, it can grow in oscillation amplitude. It is also like a spring-mass system that if you drive it on the natural frequency, it increases its length indefinitely (well…, limited by the length of the spring, but you get the idea!).

Continue reading →
